text: Protests erupted downtown after fuel price hikes. Police deployed to contain unrest.
Government announced subsidies. Tensions eased but opposition called for reforms.
Small clashes reported near the square. Security forces increased patrols.
Armed groups exchanged fire in western districts. Civilians displaced.
Ceasefire talks stalled. Renewed shelling damaged infrastructure.
Militia leaders met under UN mediation. Violence decreased temporarily.
Parliament debated budget reforms. Demonstrations remained peaceful.
Economic aid package announced. Markets reacted positively.
Minor protests occurred with no reported clashes.
